column5: Durin}}, The Line of the Dwarves of Erebor</ref> 82 years old) was one of the thirteen [[Dwarves]] who took part in the [[Quest of Erebor
column7: Erebor]], which was [[Bilbo Baggins]]'s great adventure.  He was one of the three Dwarves of [[Thorin and Company
column8: Thorin's company]] who did not survive the [[Battle of Five Armies]] (the other two being his uncle [[Thorin]] and his brother [[Kíli]].)

column1: Fíli and Kíli were the sons of [[Dís]], the sister of [[Thorin]].  Before the quest to Erebor, they probably lived in the [[Blue Mountains]] where their uncle resided after the disappearance of [[Thráin
column2: Thráin II]].<ref name="Line"/>  As Thorin's sister-sons, they accompanied their uncle when he set out to challenge the [[Dragons
column3: dragon]] [[Smaug]].  Before the Dwarves met Bilbo, [[Gandalf]] met with them and persuaded them to bring the hobbit on the quest.  At this meeting Fíli thought that Bilbo sounded like a strange creature and laughed at his name.<ref>{{UT

column1: When Bilbo first met Fíli and Kíli (in the third group of Dwarves to arrive at [[Bag End]]) they were wearing blue hoods.  After supper,  Fíli and Kíli played small fiddles that they had brought in bags.<ref>{{H
The brothers were the youngest of the company by some 50 years,<ref name="Hill">{{H
column2: Hill}}</ref> with Kíli being five years younger than his brother.<ref name="Line"/>   Although not twins, the two brothers were inseparable throughout the adventure.

column4: Adlpictures - ''Fíli'']]Early on the night when the company encountered the [[Trolls]] one of the ponies became frightened and bolted into the river; Fíli and Kíli nearly drowned getting the beast out of the water.  After the trolls had turned to stone and the company explored their hideout, it was Fíli who encouraged the others to get out of the "horrible smell" in the troll's lair.<ref>{{H

column1: Up in the [[Misty Mountains]] during the thunder-battle the two brothers, being the youngest Dwarves with the keenest eyes, were sent ahead to look for shelter.  They found a small dry cave which was perfect for the company (until the [[Orcs#Orcs and Goblins
column2: Gobins]] arrived).  After [[Gandalf]] had rescued the company and was counting the members he found Fíli and Kíli, as usual, paired together.<ref name="Hill"/>

column1: When the company rushed up into trees to escape the [[wargs]], Fíli and Kíli scrambled to the top of a tall larch.<ref>{{H
column2: Pan}}</ref>  The next day, when the company arrived at [[Beorn]]'s [[Beorn's Hall
column3: Hall]], Fíli and Kíli were again together as the fourth pair of Dwarves to appear during Gandalf's story.<ref>{{H

column1: When Bilbo spied the boat on the far side of the [[Enchanted River]], Thorin chose Fíli as the youngest<ref group="note">In ''[[The Hobbit]]'' Thorin called Fíli the youngest, but in [[Appendix A]] Fíli's date of birth was given as {{TA
column2: 2859}} while Kíli's date of birth was given as {{TA
column4: n}}.  Perhaps Thorin had trouble remembering the ages of these two "very young" Dwarves (both of whom were under age 85 at the time of the quest).</ref> with the best sight (instead of [[Dori]], the strongest) to throw a rope with a hook attached to snag the small vessel.  Fíli did manage to snag the boat on the second try but could not pull it across.  Kíli came to his aid first, followed by [[Óin]] and [[Glóin]], before the boat came loose (after its painter snapped).   When the company made the crossing they used another rope that Fíli threw ahead into the trees since the boat had no oars.<ref name="Flies">{{H

column1: After the Dwarves had been captured by [[spiders]] Bilbo climbed out on the branch where the spiders had trussed up the Dwarves.  The first bundle that Bilbo reached was Fíli, whom the hobbit recognized by the tips of his blue hood and long nose poking out of the threads.<ref group="note">The fact that Bilbo recognized Fíli by his long nose (as opposed to Kíli) shows that the two brothers were not identical in appearance.</ref>  Once freed, Fíli helped Bilbo free the other Dwarves despite being sickened by spider-poison.<ref name="Flies"/>
After the escape from the halls of the [[Thranduil
column2: Elvenking]], Fíli and Kíli came out smiling since they were young and had but few bruises.  The two brothers helped Thorin and Bilbo locate and free the other Dwarves.  Next, they accompanied Thorin and Bilbo to the bridge into [[Lake-town
column3: Esgaroth]] while the others recovered and  Fíli was the most impatient to see the [[Master of Lake-town]] at his feast.<ref>{{H

column1: When the company reached the Lonely Mountain, Thorin sent out a scouting party to view the Front Gate (or where it once stood).  Fíli and Kíli went along with [[Balin]] and Bilbo on this expedition.  On another scouting trip Bilbo was with Fíli and Kíli when the three discovered the rough steps that led up the mountain to the little bay that contained the secret door.<ref>{{H

Of the thirteen Dwarves, Fíli and Kíli looked uncomfortable when Bilbo asked for volunteers to accompany him on the first trip into the mountain (only Balin went with the hobbit for part of the way).  Once the dragon woke up though Fíli and Kíli, along with Bilbo and Balin, were the first to go in the tunnel (sent in by Thorin).<ref>{{H
While searching the treasure when the full company descended into Erebor, Fíli and Kíli were in such exuberant spirits that they took down magic golden harps and played music on them.<ref>{{H
Fíli was slain with his brother in the [[Battle of Five Armies]], while defending their mortally wounded uncle.<Ref>{{H
column2: Return}}</ref>  After Thorin's death, the brothers would have been the only remaining descendants of [[Thrór]]'s line and Fíli would have inherited the title of [[King under the Mountain]].  Their deaths ended the dynasty, and the title passed to [[Dáin Ironfoot
column3: Dáin II]].  It was their heroic last stand that made their mother the only [[Dwarf-women
column4: Dwarf-woman]] to be mentioned in the genealogies.<ref name="Line"/>

column2: Dvergatal]]''. It can mean "File" or "Filer"; it is of Frisian or Low German origin rather than Old Norse.<ref>Chester Nathan Gould, "Dwarf-Names: A Study in Old Icelandic Religion", published in ''Publications of the Modern Language Association of America'', Vol 44 (1929), issue #4, pp. 939-967</ref>

column1: <div style="overflow-x: scroll; overflow-y: hidden; border: 1px solid #AAAAAA; padding: 3px; background: #EEEEEE;">{{familytree/start}}

column2: Thorin Oakenshield]] only travels with an unnamed guard and the princess of Dale.<ref name="Deitch">{{webcite

column1: :Fíli's voice is provided by [[Jack DeLeon]]. However, he only ever speaks in unison with the rest of the Dwarves.

column7: accessed=23-Dec-2011}}</ref> O'Gorman joined the cast on [[30 April]] [[2011]] after Rob Kazinsky, who was originally cast as Fíli, left the production for personal reasons.<ref name="PJCasting1"/><ref name="PJCasting2">{{webcite
column13: accessed=23-Dec-2011}}</ref> A description of Fíli in ''The Hobbit'' films was released by the studio:

column2: Fíli was born into the royal line of Durin and raised under the stern guardianship of his uncle, Thorin Oakenshield. Along with his brother Kíli, Fíli is one of the youngest in The Company of the Dwarves. He has never traveled far, nor ever seen the fabled Dwarf City of Erebor. A skilled fighter, Fíli off on the adventure ahead with little idea of the challenges and dangers that lie before him.

column1: :  He carries many weapons, such as throwing axes, war hammers, knives and swords.<ref> [[Daniel Falconer
column2: Falconer, Daniel]]. ''[http://www.wetanz.com/chronicles-cloaks-and-daggers-signed/ The Hobbit: The Desolation of Smaug Chronicles: Cloaks and Daggers].'' p.95. </ref> When Thorin refuses to allow Kíli to go with the others to the Lonely Mountain due to his weakened state (from being struck by a poisoned arrow), Fíli opts to stay behind in [[Lake-town]] (along with de facto group healer [[Óin]]) and look after his younger brother. In the [[Battle of Five Armies]], he goes to assist [[Thorin]] (along with [[Kíli]] and [[Dwalin]]) at the top of [[Ravenhill]] in an attempt to kill the [[Orcs
column3: Orc]] army's leader, [[Azog]]. However, when searching for the Pale Orc, Fíli is cornered by him and some of his soldiers. Azog then takes Fíli out in front of the other Dwarves, impales him with the sword attached to his left arm, and drops his body onto the rock below him as the others watch in horror.

column1: :No actor is specified for the role of Fíli.

:Fíli is omitted; Thorin is the only companion of the player, [[Bilbo Baggins]].<ref>''[http://www.worldofspectrum.org/showmag.cgi?mag=ZXComputing/Issue8304/Pages/ZXComputing830400076.jpg ZX Computing]'', 8304 (April/May 1983), p. 76, accessed [[24 April
:No actor is credited for the role of Fíli.
